content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Below is an implementation in Julia for your request:

```julia
using Markdown

function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    doc = parse_md(md) # Convert the markdown to Document object
    blocks = []  # Array to hold code blocks

    for block in doc.content
        if typeof(block) == CodeBlock && occursin("julia", block.language)
            push!(blocks, block.code)
        end
    end

    if length(blocks) > 0
        return join([strip(block, leading=true, trailing=true) for block in blocks], "\n") # Join code blocks with newline and remove leading/trailing whitespaces
    else
        return "" # Return empty string if no julia code found
    end
end
```

This function works by parsing the markdown into a Document object, then iterating over each block in the document. If a CodeBlock is found with "julia" as its language, it's appended to the `blocks` array. Finally, if there are any blocks collected, they are joined together with newline characters and returned as a single string. If no julia code blocks are found, an empty string is returned.

The function also removes leading or trailing whitespaces in each block of code before joining them together.
